newsitem.title: UK: Allied Teachers sales fall sharply-Stats MR.
newsitem.headline: Allied Teachers sales fall sharply-Stats MR.

text.p: Sales of Teachers, a blended whisky owned by Allied Domecq, fell sharply in the six months to December 1996, according to data compiled by Stats MR.
Sales of Teachers to the on trade -- pubs, clubs and restaurants -- was 14 percent down, said Stats MR.
Teachers is the third largest Scotch whisky blend in Britain behind Bells, owned by Guinness Plc and Famous Grouse, Highland Distilleries Co Plc leading brand.

In the so-called off trade -- supermarkets and other retailers -- Teachers fell 28.6 percent, Bell's was off 10.7 percent and Famous Grouse 3.5 percent, said Stats MR figures issued by Highland at a news conference called to present its half year results.
In the on trade, blended Whisky Bell's rose 1.7 percent, while Famous Grouse, owned by Highland, increased by 7.0 percent.
Overall the industry increased sales to the on trade during the period by 0.8 percent, according to Stats MR.
Overall sales by the industry to the off trade were down 6.4 percent, said the data.
A spokesman for Allied declined to comment on the data. -- Tim Farrand +44 171 542 6437 Stats MR St Albans -- 01727833261.
